meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something so that it becomes flat or compacted.
meanings.sent1: She squooshed the playdough into a small ball.
meanings.sent2: The cat squooshed itself into the tiny box.
meanings.sent3: The sandwich was squooshed in her bag, but it still tasted good.
meanings.sent4: The car tires squooshed the mud as it drove through the puddle.
meanings.sent5: He squooshed the empty bottle to fit it into the recycling bin.

meanings.sent1: The sponge squooshed easily in her hand.
meanings.sent2: The balloon squooshed when she accidentally sat on it.
meanings.sent3: The stress ball squooshed out of shape after too much squeezing.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt squooshed when he saw the sad puppy.
meanings.sent5: The toothpaste tube was squooshed from the middle, making it hard to use.

meanings.definition: To crush or flatten something by applying pressure.
meanings.sent1: He squooshed the can to fit it into the recycling bin.
meanings.sent2: The heavy book squooshed the delicate flower beneath it.
meanings.sent3: The pillow was squooshed flat after years of use.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the snow squooshed the branches of the tree.
meanings.sent5: She accidentally squooshed the cupcake while trying to frost it.
